title: AI Guides: Approved AI Tools
content: Simplifi Guidelines: AI Employee Usage As an employee, it is your responsibility to understand how AI systems process data and to ensure that only suitable information is entered into these systems. This obligation is an extension of the confidentiality clause you signed upon your employment with Simplifi. Any incidents involving the disclosure of confidential or highly confidential information, whether within these systems or similar ones, may lead to disciplinary action. For general inquiries regarding AI tools, please reach out to the #digital-workplace Slack channel or Request Access to approved Ai tools. If you have questions about your responsibilities in evaluating AI tools for personal use or need guidance on initiating a compliance review, please refer to the following pages: We encourage everyone to default to Gemini , our official AI tool. Other approved tools are listed below: List of Approved AI Tools Gemini (already available in your Okta dashboard) Cursor ( Request Access ) Open AI’s ChatGPT ( Request Access ) GitHub Copilot ( Request Access ) Make ( Request Access ) Waymark ( Request Access ) Dall-E Grammarly Copilot (this includes the use of autocomplete for code writing) ChatSpot AI by GitHub Zoom AI Reclaim AI Monday Asana Clockwise Typewise

title: AI Usage Policy and Guidelines: Individual Employee Use
content: FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY - DO NOT DISTRIBUTE Simplifi empowers employees to leverage Artificial Intelligence (AI) for day-to-day operations to enhance productivity. This document outlines the process and steps required for the safe and compliant use of AI for individual employee use. Adhering to these guidelines helps prevent misuse of company proprietary information and security incidents, ensuring data protection and compliance with legal limits and privacy policies. Support or Feedback For questions, comments, or feedback regarding this AI policy or AI usage, please contact Ryan Falsetti, Privacy Compliance Manager, via Slack or email the Privacy Team at privacy@simpli.fi . The Privacy Team is available to assist with any inquiries related to AI compliance, data use, and security. Mandatory AI Tool Approval Checklist: Before Using New AI Systems Before deploying any new AI system, AI tool, or AI software, employees must complete the following checklist to ensure safe and approved AI usage. This process helps troubleshoot potential compliance issues and data risks. 1. Legal Compliance and Approved Tools Approved AI Tools: Check if the AI tool is already approved for Simplifi use. A list of existing software tools with Embedded AI Tools that are approved at Simplifi can be found [here - link to be inserted]. Unlisted Tools: If an AI tool is not listed on the approved software list, its use is not prohibited automatically. However, you must notify the Compliance Team (via the Privacy Team at privacy@simpli.fi ) about the tool being used for their records. The Compliance Team will then add it to the approved list after review. Legal Expertise & Contract Review: Does the AI tool require legal expertise or involve the review of a contract? If yes, you must follow the AI Use for Enterprise Process. Non-Public Simplifi Information: Will the AI tool process or use Non-Public Simplifi information? If yes, you must follow the AI Use for Enterprise Process. 2. Data Use and Confidentiality Confidential or Sensitive Information: Will the AI process or use any confidential information or sensitive information? Discrimination Risk: Could the AI be used in a way that discriminates based on protected characteristics (e.g., gender, race, sexual orientation, political affiliation)? This includes potential bias in AI-generated content. Action Required for Confidential/Sensitive Data: If yes to either of the above data use questions, immediately email privacy@simpli.fi . Include all relevant information about the AI program and a list of the specific data elements you intend to use. If no to both questions, you may proceed to the next step. Privacy Assessment: Once the Privacy Team reviews the data use details, they will conduct a privacy assessment to identify and mitigate any areas of risk related to data handling and security. 3. Policy Review and External AI Privacy Product Privacy Policy Review: You are required to review the product’s privacy policy for any AI system you intend to use. Warning: Be highly cautious of privacy policies that allow all information entered into their system to be used to train their AI model. This poses a significant data privacy risk. Data Collection & Usage Awareness: Are you fully aware of what data the AI service collects and how that data is used by the third-party provider? Concerns & Assistance: If you have any questions or concerns about an AI product's privacy policy, send the policy to the Privacy Team at privacy@simpli.fi for assistance and review. Employee Liability: Remember, your actions play a direct role in the security of the organization. Depending on the scenario, employees could be held liable for misuse of company proprietary information or security incidents resulting from unapproved or non-compliant AI usage. 4. Review Plan for AI Output Accuracy and Bias Check: Is there a plan or process for reviewing AI-generated content (e.g., AI writing, AI data, summaries, code generation) for accuracy and bias? Understandability & Verification: Is the AI output something you fully understand and can verify for accuracy? This is critical for preventing incorrect information or misleading data.

title: Enterprise AI: Implementation and Non-Public Information Usage Policy
content: FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY - DO NOT DISTRIBUTE Simplifi recognizes Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a strategic component for developing and improving products, processes, and procedures. This document outlines the essential steps required to implement AI at the Enterprise level or to use AI tools that handle non-public Simplifi information. Adhering to this policy ensures compliance, data security, and proper risk management for all enterprise AI initiatives. Support or Feedback For questions, comments, or feedback concerning this Enterprise AI policy or the AI approval process, please contact Ryan Falsetti, Privacy Compliance Manager, via Slack or email the Compliance Team directly at privacy@simpli.fi . The Compliance Team is available to assist with your inquiries and provide guidance on AI implementation and compliance requirements. Enterprise AI Approval Process This multi-step approval process is mandatory for all enterprise AI projects and AI tools using non-public Simplifi data. Following these steps will streamline AI adoption while ensuring security and regulatory compliance. Step One: Initial Discussion and Request Submission Manager Discussion: Begin by discussing the AI tool and its specific use case with your manager or team lead. Clarify the purpose and benefits of the AI integration. Paid AI Tools: If the AI tool is paid software, obtain manager approval. Your manager must then submit the request to the Procurement team by creating a Jira ticket. This initiates the procurement process for the new AI solution. Free AI Tools using Non-Public Information: If the AI tool is free but will be processing or using non-public Simplifi information (e.g., confidential data, proprietary data, sensitive company information), you must create a Jira ticket. For the "Project" field in Jira, select "Compliance." This action automatically kicks off a compliance review for the AI tool and its intended data use. Step Two: Compliance Review and Assessment Forms Compliance Team Contact: After creating the Jira ticket (for either procurement or compliance), the Compliance Team will contact you. Privacy & AI Pre-Assessment Forms: If deemed necessary, you will receive a copy of the Privacy Pre-Assessment form and the included AI Pre-Assessment Form. Completing these forms is crucial for the Compliance Team to understand what data is being used by the AI tool and how it will be processed, handled, and stored. Data Privacy/Security Assessment Determination: The Compliance Team will review the completed assessment forms. Based on this review, they will determine whether a full Data Privacy/Security Assessment needs to be conducted, especially if the AI use case involves high-risk processing or falls under regulations like GDPR and CCPA. Step Three: Risk Assessment and Documentation High-Risk Processing Assessment: If a Data Privacy/Security Assessment needs to be conducted due to high-risk processing (e.g., handling Personal Identifiable Information (PII), sensitive data categories, large-scale data processing), the Compliance Team will conduct this additional assessment with you. This collaborative process ensures all risks are identified and mitigated. No Assessment Required (Documented Justification): If an assessment does not need to be done due to the low nature of the risk, the Compliance Team will produce clear documentation stating that a risk assessment is not required and will explain the rationale. This decision will be documented in Vanta for audit and record-keeping purposes. Step Four: Implementation and Ongoing Management Ongoing Compliance Communication: As you implement the AI tool, it is critical to keep the Compliance Team apprised of any new developments, changes in scope, or unexpected changes related to the AI system or its data usage. Compliance Team Involvement for High-Risk Projects: If PII (Personal Identifiable Information) is being used by the AI tool, or if the AI tool could present a security risk if not implemented properly, you must invite the relevant Compliance Team members to planning and onboarding calls. Their assistance during these critical phases is vital to ensure proper security controls and data governance are in place from the outset, preventing project delays or compliance issues down the line. This proactive engagement is key to successful and secure AI deployment.

title: AWS Key Guide: AWS Key Rotation Guidelines and Best Practices
content: The Digital Workplace team's audit of user key rotation in Q3-Q4 2023 highlighted challenges not fully addressed by previous AWS documentation. This led to a re-evaluation of how Simplifi manages AWS access for external clients and internal users , particularly concerning AWS IAM Administration . Historical Challenges with User Key Rotation Historically, Simplifi provided AWS access to external clients by adding users to our AWS IAM Administration or, in some instances, by sharing users directly with clients. This approach has presented difficulties, especially with rotating user keys. To maintain compliance with the standards set by one of Simplifi's private equity firms (GTCR), user AWS keys must be rotated every 90 days. This requirement became problematic when managing numerous external client users. Recommended Best Practice: AWS ARN for Bucket Policies When granting external clients access to Simplifi S3 buckets, the recommended and most secure approach is to request the client's AWS ARNs (Amazon Resource Names) for the roles they maintain. These ARNs can then be directly added to the S3 bucket policy. This method offers significant advantages over Simplifi maintaining individual users for clients: It eliminates the need for Simplifi to manage and rotate client user keys every 90 days, ensuring ongoing compliance with key rotation standards. It shifts the responsibility of user management and key rotation back to the client, simplifying Simplifi's IAM administration. Future Enhancements and Current Support The Infrastructure Value Stream Team is currently exploring long-term solutions, such as implementing the AWS KWS solution to auto-rotate AWS user keys for both clients and internal users. In the interim, your assistance is crucial in encouraging clients to configure their AWS access at the bucket policy level using ARNs. This collaborative effort helps maintain our security posture and compliance. Additional Context For more context on the key rotation audit , please refer to the following Slack channel: #proj-aws-keys-update .

title: Digital Workplace Solutions: Jira Service Desk
content: HALP! The Digital Workplace team has historically assisted users through SIX different means: Okta Access Requests Portal Okta Slack App Access Shortcuts #digital-workplace Slack channel digitalworkplace@simpli.fi Email Address workflow-automations-notifications channel (alerts us when there are manual tasks to complete based on workflow triggers with applications that we set in Okta) Individual DMs in Slack (not recommended Help Us Help You In the coming months, we’ll be building out bot workflows to respond to keywords in your messages. These will share resources and tips with you related to your inquiry. However, it’s not going to be perfect. Like any other language model or human behavior, it benefits from training. title: Digital Workplace Service Desk: Agent Instructions & Use Cases
content: Introduction: Use Cases Welcome, Digital Workplace Service Desk (DWS) agents! You've been added to our team to manage critical workflows across various areas. Your responsibilities include taking action on tickets related to: Employee Lifecycle Events : Onboarding, off-boarding, role changes, etc. Application Approvals : Managing access requests for applications you oversee. Data Privacy and Compliance : Handling requests concerning sensitive data and regulatory adherence. Hardware and Peripherals : Fulfilling requests for equipment and devices. Security Incidents : Addressing and resolving security-related issues. Managing Your Assigned Tickets When a triggering event occurs, you'll receive an assigned ticket. This could be a task, access request, security request, hardware request, or a general support issue. Here are the instructions for how you can efficiently resolve these requests: Accessing Your Tickets : Log into Jira to view the Service Desk Portal issues assigned to you in your "My Open Issues" in the queue . Alternatively, you can click the link in the Jira email notification you receive when an issue is assigned. Changing Assignee : To assign a ticket to yourself or reassign it to another DWS agent, select the "Assignee" field on the right-hand side of the issue in Jira. Choose the appropriate agent from the dropdown. Updating Ticket Status : Start Work : When you're ready to begin working on a ticket, change its status from "Open" to "Work in Progress." You can do this directly on the ticket in Jira, or by using the relevant emoji in the #digital-workplace Slack channel if the request originated there. → Will assign the ticket to you. → Will automatically close out the ticket -> Will assign to Work in Progress or Pending Pause SLA (Pending) : If you need to pause the SLA (Service Level Agreement) clock because you're waiting for information or action from the requester, a vendor, or another party, change the ticket status from "Work in Progress" to "Pending." You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the relevant emoji in the #digital-workplace Slack channel . Close Ticket : Once you've successfully addressed and resolved the issue, change the ticket status from "Pending" or "Work in Progress" to "Closed." This can be done directly on the ticket in Jira, or via the relevant emoji in the #digital-workplace Slack channel . Commenting on Issues : You can add comments to an issue via Slack (if it originated in the #digital-workplace channel) or directly through the Jira interface. Add internal note: Use this option if your comment is only for other service desk agents. This is ideal for resolution notes, troubleshooting steps, or questions for colleagues. Reply to customer: Choose this option if your comment is intended to be visible to the requester. This will also send them an email notification, depending on their Jira notification settings. Log into Jira to see the Service Desk Portal issues you have assigned to yourself in the queue (My Open Issues). Alternatively, you can click the link in an email from Jira when notified of the issue assignment. To change an assignee (whether assigning to yourself or someone else), select the Assignee field on the right-hand side of the issue. You have the option to assign it to yourself or another person with agent access to the DWS service desk. When you are ready to start work on the ticket, move it from Open to Work in Progress . You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the emoji in #digital-workplace if the request originated there. If you need to pause the SLA clock on a ticket because you are waiting on something from the requester, a vendor, or other party, move the ticket from Work in Progress to Pending . You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the emoji in #digital-workplace if the request originated there. You can comment on the issue via Slack (if it was submitted in #digital-workplace channel at its inception), or via the Jira interface. If you need to comment on the issue in Jira, there are two options: Add internal note : Will only show the comment to fellow service desk agents. This is often used to communicate issue resolution notes or questions for other agents. Reply to customer : Will show the comment as visible to the issue’s requestor, and will also send them an email (depending on whether they’ve turned off Jira notifications to email). When you have addressed the issue in the ticket, move it from its Pending or Work in Progress status to a Closed status. You can do this on the ticket itself, or via the emoji in #digital-workplace if the request originated there. Reminder Messages Once a week, an Okta workflow will message you in Slack if you have any outstanding Digital Workplace service desk tickets that are not closed. Advanced Handling: Keyboard Shortcuts If you despise clicking around on a ticket, you might enjoy utilizing the Atlassian Jira Keyboard Shortcuts . These allow you to quickly open ( o ), assign to someone else ( a ), assign to yourself ( i ), or add a comment ( m ) among other options.

title: Confluence Quick Search with Chrome Omnibox Search Bar
content: If you have a question and need to quickly find a solution in Confluence, you can do so directly from your Google Chrome search bar (also known as the omnibox). This method allows for rapid knowledge base searches. Instructions to Set Up Confluence Site Search Open Chrome Settings : In the corner menu of your Chrome browser, click the icon for "more options" (usually three vertical dots), then click "Settings." Navigate to Search Engine Settings : Scroll down the settings page and click "Search engine" on the left-hand sidebar navigation menu. Manage Search Engines : Click "Manage search engines and site search." Add New Site Search : Under the "Site search" section, click "Add." Enter Search Details : You can choose your own search engine title (e.g., "Simplifi Confluence") and keyword (e.g., "conf", "confluence", "wiki"). Crucially, use this exact URL for the query string: "https://simplifi.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action?queryString=%s" Save Configuration : Click "Save." How to Use the Confluence Quick Search Now, when you have a question for the Simplifi knowledge base , simply: Type your chosen keyword (e.g., "conf") into your Chrome omnibox (address bar) . Press the space bar . The omnibox will now recognize it as a Confluence search . Type your search query (e.g., "vpn setup" or "password reset"). Press Enter to instantly search the Simplifi Confluence site. Example for Salesforce : You could "ADD" another search engine. In this case, the URL would be: https://na43.salesforce.com/_ui/search/ui/UnifiedSearchResults?searchType=2&sen=500&sen=005&str=%s This feature allows you to create custom search shortcuts for any frequently used website, significantly boosting your search efficiency.

title: Bitwarden Guide: Access and Logging into with Okta SSO
content: This document provides a comprehensive guide to Bitwarden, explaining its purpose and detailing the steps for requesting access, activating your account, accessing the application, and troubleshooting common issues. Note: Screen shots are for representation only and may have been changed on the Bitwarden site. What is Bitwarden Bitwarden is a secure password manager used to securely store shared passwords and keys among teams. It provides a centralized and encrypted vault for managing sensitive credentials, enhancing security and collaboration. I. Requesting Access to Bitwarden The Digital Workplace team has developed an automated self-service request process for quick access to the Bitwarden platform. There are several ways listed below to initiate your Bitwarden access. Slack. (2 Options) Slack Option 1: Request via Slack (Okta App) Search for the Okta app under "Apps" in Slack. If it's not visible, click "Add apps" and select the Okta app. Under the "Home" tab of the Okta app, click "Choose a resource." Select: "Bitwarden" Slack Option 2 : Request via Slack (#digital-workplace channel command) From within the #digital-workplace Slack channel , type the following command directly into the channel (case sensitive): /access Bitwarden click continue and you will begin the same process. c. Add a short description why you are requesting access. d. Select Yes/No if your manager is available. - If manager is not available, the approval process goes to the Digital Workplace team. e. Click Submit. f. A Jira ticket will be generated and assigned the status of Waiting Approval . Once approval is obtained, proceed to Step II below to send the Activation Email and complete the setup of your account. Request from the Okta Access Request Panel a. Navigate to your Okta dashboard and select the tile labeled "Okta Access Request." b. This will open a separate console for you to request the Bitwarden app (along with many other apps) click the Request access and you will be prompted with same or similar steps and questions as above. Request For: Select ‘You’ and fill out questions and click Submit. note: You can submit a request on behalf of another user. Step II. Activation Email After submitting your request, please check your email for the account activation message. Click Go to vault. Enter in your email if not autofilled. Click Continue. Click the Log in Option. Click sign-in with Enterprise single sign-on. If you are not currently logged into your Okta console, you will be prompted to authenticate using your Okta credentials. After successfully authenticating, the next step is to establish your Master Password. It is crucial to adhere to the complexity guidelines while creating this password. This Master Password works in conjunction with Okta authentication and is integrated directly into the app. Click submit. You will need to enter in your Master Password to access your vault now after . Account Confirmation: Once your account is created, the Digital Workplace team will verify it within the Bitwarden administration tenant, adding an extra layer of security. Step III: Accessing Bitwarden the app. You will find a Bitwarden tile on your Okta dashboard, which currently directs you to the Bitwarden login page. Once there, you will need to enter your credentials. You can also Navigate to https://vault.bitwarden.com/#/login directly. Enter your email address and continue. You can either click "Continue" or utilize "Single Sign-On." Both options will authenticate you through Okta seamlessly in the background. Once Okta Authenticates your account, you will be prompted to enter in your Master Password to get to your console. Desktop Downloads: Bitwarden is available as a desktop application for Mac, Windows, and Linux. https://bitwarden.com/download/ Browser Extensions: Bitwarden is available as a browser extension for the following: Google Chrome Mozilla Firefox Opera Microsoft Edge Safari The Current Browser extension integrations process can be found at: https://bitwarden.com/help/article/getting-started-browserext/ Troubleshooting In the event you have created an account with your simpli.fi email address but it is NOT tied to our organization tenant. Then you will need to go through the steps to remove that account so that it can be added back into our tenant. WARNING! if you have any saved passwords/keys/etc you will need to export this data or copy it down because it WILL BE DELETED and you will not be able to recover. https://bitwarden.com/help/delete-your-account/

title: Bitwarden Guide: Tips for Managing Bitwarden Records
content: Page Directory: Creating new records When creating new records in BW, you can either save them to your personal vault or a shared vault. Browser Extension: From your browser extension, click the '+' sign in the top right Enter the following details: Name: <record name> Username: <username or email associated with login> Password: <enter a password or generate one by clicking the icon> URI: <the url of the website this record is for> Optionally, you can setup an Authenticator Key (TOTP) if you need to use MFA for this account. Clicking the camera icon will scan the QR code for you, or you can manually enter the code. IMPORTANT: scroll to the bottom and set the ownership for this record. If you need to add it to a shared collection, select ‘ Simpli.fi ’ and select the collection(s). Web Page: 1. In the top right, click New > Item Follow the same instructions above Accessing personal records Browser Extension: From your browser extension, click ‘Vault’ at the bottom, then All vaults > My vault Web Page: Under ‘All Vaults’ on the left, select ‘My Vault’ Accessing shared records in a vault You can use the search bar to find all records, or search through the collections: Browser Extension: From your browser extension, click ‘Vault’ at the bottom, then All vaults > My vault Web Page: Under ‘All Vaults’ on the left, select ‘My Vault’ Redeeming free Bitwarden for Families account Bitwarden provides a complimentary family account that can be accessed through your work account. The Bitwarden for Families plan includes: Premium access for up to 6 users Shared collections for family secrets To take advantage of this feature, please follow the steps outlined below: Log in to the Bitwarden web console using the link available in your Okta dashboard. In the left-side menu, select Settings > Free Bitwarden Families . Send an invitation to your personal email. (Note: If you already have an existing Bitwarden account, this will create a new ‘Organization’ under your personal account.)

title: Datadog Guide: Applications Keys & Service Accounts
content: Service accounts are non-interactive accounts designed to manage application keys and other resources shared among teams. For instance, consider a scenario where an employee creates a monitoring dashboard using their personal application key. If that employee departs from the company, their Datadog account is deactivated, rendering their application key inactive. Consequently, the monitoring dashboard will cease to function until someone updates it with a valid application key. To prevent this issue, utilizing a service account application key instead of a personal application key for automated requests to the Datadog API is highly recommended. Note: Creating Service Accounts requires admin access. To view / access service accounts in the UI: Navigate to Organization Settings from your account menu. Under Accounts , select Service Accounts . Create service account To create a service account, perform the following steps: Click New Service Account . A dialog box appears. Enter a name and email address for your service account. Note: This can be a Google Group email address. Use the Assign Roles dropdown menu to choose one or more roles for your service account. Custom roles can be created to ensure that the service account has only the access it needs. Find out how to create custom roles here. To save, click Create Service Account . Unlike the email addresses for Datadog users, service account email addresses do not need to be unique across an organization. Edit service account To modify a service account, click on one in the service accounts list. In the side panel, click Edit next to the service account name. A dialog box appears. Update any fields you would like to change. You can edit the name, email address, status, and roles. Click Save . To disable a service account, follow the procedure above to edit the service account and set the status to Disabled . Create or revoke application keys To create or revoke service account application keys, select an account from the service account list. The service account’s side panel appears. To create a new application key, follow the steps below: Click New Key . A dialog box appears. Give the key a descriptive name. Click Create Key . The dialog box refreshes, showing you the key. Copy and paste the key into your desired location. After you close the dialog box, you cannot retrieve the value of the key. To revoke an application key, locate the key in the service account detailed view side panel and hover over it. You will see pencil and trash can icons appear on the right side. Click the trash can icon to revoke the key. After revocation, click Confirm . Note: You can view a service account application key only once, immediately after its creation. Limiting access to the application key helps prevent issues that may arise if another user gains access to it. If you lose or forget a service account key, revoke it and create a new one. Permissions Creating a service account allows you to establish an entity that interacts with Datadog on your behalf. The options available to you on the Service Accounts page are determined by your specific Datadog roles and permissions. To create a service account, you must possess the Service Account Write permission. This permission is included in the Datadog Admin role, meaning that anyone with this role can create service accounts. When setting up a service account, you have the flexibility to assign it any combination of the roles and permissions that you hold. However, if you have the User Access Manage permission, you effectively gain administrator-level access, allowing you to perform any action within Datadog. Accounts with the User Access Manage permission face no limitations regarding the roles and permissions they can assign to service accounts. Notifications Datadog sends a notification to the email address associated with the service account when the following actions occur: Create an application key Revoke an application key Disable the service account

title: Docker Access
content: Request Access through the Okta access request portal. If you have completed and you have received a slack message letting you know that you have access. Go to step 2. Refresh your Okta dashboard and look for the tile below. This will take you to the Docker sign in page. You can also navigate directly to hub.docker.com Okta cannot authenticate you directly into Docker because of a limitation on the Docker side. Click the Sign in button in the upper right hand corner. The first time you sign in, the page will look like this below, enter your simplifi email address and click continue. Okta will then authenticate your account. The next time you sign in, it will save your email address.

title: DocuSign CLM
content: As noted in the rationale behind transitioning to DocuSign , and desired DocuSign functionality , Simplifi uses DocuSign Contract Lifecycle Management to ensure centralized, streamline process for any vendor contracts and client contracts. There are thus two use cases for the DocuSign CLM: of new software applications or vendors to be used at the enterprise level. This would include: Contracts Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreements Data Processing Agreements Master Service Agreements Sales pipeline management Insertion Orders The former is exclusively managed within DocuSign CLM workflows, which generate tasks for approval by needed teams (Business Development, Finance, Security, Digital Workplace) and authorized departmental buyers. The latter (sales use case) is managed through an integration with DocuSign CLM and Salesforce DocuSign App Launcher. It is specifically targeted at new insertion orders. For more information on DocuSign CLM, please see the following technical guides (currently under construction--more to come!):

title: DocuSign CLM: Overview
content: Who Uses DocuSign CLM? Our consulting firm for the CLM Implementation provided the below training in January 2025. They delivered the training to those who could in turn train the primary users of the platform. To review, the primary users of DocuSign CLM are: Authorized buyers within each department who will submit vendor quotes or renewals for review by the Business Development Procurement Team, Legal Team, Compliance Team, Digital Workplace Team, FP&A Team, and Digital Workplace team members for comments, red-lining, and approvals. Task Group members within Business Development, Financial Planning & Analysis, Accounting, and Digital Workplace teams who are responsible for reviewing the legal, compliance, financial, and security concerns for new and existing vendors. Sales personnel who will be able to view clients' IOs in the CLM (in addition to having a link to the DocuSign record in Salesforce via the DocuSign App Launcher <> Salesforce integration).

title: DocuSign CLM: DocuSign Edit App
content: As part of DocuSign CLM, you can easily edit DocuSign documents that are Word Documents through two ways. When viewing a document during an approval step or task, you can either: From the Edit menu, select Open document OR From the Edit menu, select Open with Office Online If you do not want to simply open a copy in Office Online and have to re-upload it into DocuSign CLM, you can use the DocuSign Edit App by following the first step ( Open document ). Instructions Once in the task and viewing the affiliated document, you can select Edit in the upper right-hand corner. From the drop-down menu, select Open document . Once you do, you will be prompted to download the Docusign Edit app if you have not previously done so. Proceed to download from the DocuSign support article , selecting the option for macOS. Follow the installation guide upon opening the DocuSignEdit.pkg on your computer. After it is installed, when you go to select the Open document , you will then be prompted to authorize your DocuSign Edit app by logging into DocuSign. Upon following the prompt to log into DocuSign, you will then have your application authorized. These steps are only needed the first time you select the Open document option.

title: DocuSign E-Signature
content: Simpli.fi uses DocuSign to manage important employee and client documents in need of signature. Effective September 1, 2024, it is the e-signature application of choice for all Simpli.fi employee use cases. What follows are supplemental, internal instructions for:

title: DocuSign Google Integration
content: With the DocuSign Google Integration, you can sign documents, send documents, and take critical actions from within your everyday use of the Google Suite interface. Please only using this integration if you have a DocuSign account through Simpli.fi . You can obtain this DocuSign account by requesting access (in the Okta Access Request portal or via Slack /access docusign shortcut.) The DocuSign Google integration is pre-installed in your Google applications. You can utilize it by taking the actions below: Instructions Log into your Google mail inbox via your Okta portal or by going directly to mail.google.com. On the right-hand, side navigation menu, you’ll notice that the DocuSign app has been added to your Gmail integrations. Click the DocuSign logo. Authorize the application to see relevant data in Google. by clicking the Authorize access button. Select the Simpli.fi account you’d like to authorize and click Continue . If you are comfortable with the permissions, click Allow . Click the Log In button that shows after approving access. You will be prompted to enter your Simpli.fi email. Select Use company login when prompted. Provided you have an account with us via Okta, Okta will pass your credentials and complete the integration. Once you have authorized the integration, you will be able to quickly set up any received PDF for signatures (or sign yourself). Through this integration, you can also opt into saving important documents to your Google Drive. This will allow your team members to have access to files once constrained to the visibility of your inbox. ( For more information, check out the DocuSign marketing collateral on this feature! )

title: Transition from Adobe Acrobat Sign
content: Context for the Decision Historically, Simpli.fi has used Acrobat Sign for external documents sent to clients (insertion orders from the Sales Department primarily). It has used DocuSign for internal use cases (HR, Accounting, Legal primarily). Over the last few months, the Digital Workplace team reviewed the following items with stakeholders invested in e-signature tool selection: the user experience (access, UI design, ease of use) support experience (submitting tickets, professional services) administrative burden (Okta, licensing and billing model) feature sets of available e-signature tools (future integrations with Salesforce and Netsuite for Contract Lifecycle Management) As of August 2024, we have confirmed stakeholders' preference in consolidating to DocuSign as our sole e-signature platform for outbound signatures.

title: FAQ's: The Move to DocuSign
content: What does this mean for me as an Acrobat Sign user? If you need to be able to edit PDFs frequently, you can utilize Acrobat Business Standard. We will keep this functionality available and have licenses already assigned to those who have needed it historically. If you currently use Adobe Acrobat Sign for documents sent for electronic signatures, you will receive a direct Slack message notifying you of this change and confirming that you have been assigned a DocuSign account ( ). Does this impact other Adobe products? No. Anyone who needs access to Creative Cloud products (e.g., Illustrator, PhotoShop, Acrobat Pro) will still keep these licenses. When will this change take place? We have access to DocuSign currently and will be adding all Adobe Users into DocuSign Okta groups starting August 19th. When should I stop using AdobeSign? Please stop using AdobeSign as soon as you see the DocuSign tile in your Okta dashboard (by end of day August 19th). We will hide the AdobeSign Okta tile on August 20th so as to prevent confusion; but please also stop sending files for signature through it. What will happen to all of my files? You can download your Acrobat Sign files to your team’s shared Google Drive (preferable). If your team does not have a shared Google Drive, consider creating one

title: Future DocuSign Functionality
content: DocuSign is currently somewhat manual, wherein people upload documents or use document templates to send for signature. The user then can download to their personal or shared Google Driver folders. One exception is for the Software Sales team that utilizes Salesforce CPQ+ . This is a fully integrated solution to initiate document generation, sending, approval, and storage in Salesforce. Beginning September 1, 2024, the Digital Workplace team is partnering with Business Solutions and Sales team stakeholders to explore options for: Automations to store relevant DocuSign files in Salesforce accounts (goal for January 1, 2025) Contract Lifecycle Management with DocuSign<>Salesforce (exploring functionality) CPQ+ for Media Planning team (very long term goal) The goals of these explorations are to: reduce toil for salespersons in crafting Insertion Orders, reduce turnaround time for getting signatures share relevant IOs with anyone working on the account currently or in the future Update! As of November 2024, we have begun the process to streamline the IO creation and sending experience with the DocuSign<>Salesforce integration (to be deployed to all Sales team members in December 2024). We are also kicking off the DocuSign Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) feature set in November 2024 to further provide visibility and automated organization of all Sales contracts.

title: Donut Slack App
content: https://www.donut.com/ Connect around the watercooler, anywhere Connect serendipitously for virtual coffee, peer learning, birthday and work anniversary celebrations, DEI discussions, and more. We all need friends at work. Having authentic relationships with our colleagues makes us more productive, 7x more engaged, and increases our happiness as much as a $100,000 raise. Over 15,000 teams like Okta, Betterment, Gitlab, Zapier, and InVision have used Donut to make 6+ million connections among teammates across departments, office locations, and continents. Donut makes connections across the organization, for teams of all sizes in three ways: by encouraging in-person or virtual meetups, asynchronous banter, and more festive birthday and work anniversary celebrations. How to join a Donut To join the primary Engineering Donut Join #engineering-watercooler to be automatically added to the Donut rotation Intros every 2 weeks Donut Etiquette If you are unable to regularly join and participate in donuts, consider: Pausing your Donut pairing (instructions) Leaving the Donut channel Come ready to connect and have fun Be present in your conversation Be as vulnerable as possible to put the other person(s) at ease Have your camera on Have some icebreaker questions ready in case the conversation stalls If you identify something about work you need to discuss, consider having another meeting outside the Donut to discuss further (especially if another person is on the call that the work discussion doesn’t apply to)

title: GitHub Enterprise
content: This guide will be used for using/accessing Github and Service Account usage in Github. GitHub Account To gain access into Simplifi’s github organization, you will need to already have a Github account in place. Digital Workplace doesnt typically handle the creation of the actual Github account, only the access that is needed once the account is in place. This is because a high majority of users already have an account and we can easily assign / unassign access with those accounts. If you already have a Github account, Skip to Step 3 in the Create an account section. Create an Account. If we assist in the account creation, typically we recommend using this format. firstNameLastName-simpli and use your current simplifi email address. Once you have created your personal account, you have to enable 2FA to your account. Typically, this is done with Google Authenticator. (This account access is separate from Okta, because this is technically a ‘personal’ account into Github itself) Once you have your account setup, you need to request access through the Okta access request system. https://simplifi.atlassian.net/l/cp/juu4yF42 You should receive an invite that will add your user account to the Simplifi Github Organization. Accessing Simplifi’s GitHub Org. Under your profile you should see in your organizations the green Simplifi logo. To gain access into this org, you WILL be required to authenticate with your Okta credentials. If you receive an error, or a message informing you that you hve not been assigned this application, please go through the access request option above in Step 3. Service Account Access Service account access works the same way as a personal account access would. - Log in to the Github account with 2FA to authenticate against GitHubs tenant. - Authenticate against Okta to gain access into our Simplifi Organization. Steps to log in with a SA. You will need to have Bitwarden access with access to the Github and/or Infrastructure vaults. If you do not have access to Bitwarden, please refer to Step 3 from above to request access. In the vault, you should see the Github account information that logs you into Github itself. Here you will have the username/pw and Authentication Code(TOTP) to get logged in. Once logged into Github, you will also have to authenticate with Okta to get into the Org. These typically have the Github-Okta naming convention as shown below. This will give you the same information as above to get authenticated via Okta. username/password and Authentication Code(TOTP) ReAuthenticating Personal account keys with SAML. If you have created any personal account keys, whether its your own account or a service account. You will need to resynch your keys to the new SAML login. This information can be located here in Githubs documentation. https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/authentication/authenticating-with-saml-single-sign-on/authorizing-a-personal-access-token-for-use-with-saml-single-sign-on SSH Keys https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/authentication/authenticating-wit[…]gn-on/authorizing-an-ssh-key-for-use-with-saml-single-sign-on Administration: To remove an external user from GitHub, follow these steps: Click on the three dots next to the Outside Collaborator. Remove the external user from all repositories associated with your GitHub account.

title: 2FA for Service Accounts in GitHub
content: How to enable 2FA (aka MFA) for service accounts in GitHub. Login to GitHub using the credentials in Bitwarden. Click the avatar in the upper right corner and click Settings Click to enable two factor authentication Under Setup authenticator app , click setup key Click to download recovery codes Need more details: GitHub 2FA Documentation

title: Apple vs. Microsoft vs. Google
content: You may have noticed that, depending on your team, you have varying access or preferences regarding the use of core applications (for things like word processing, number crunching, presentation design, and even… email.) Why is that? with a free account. If you need to be able to host a teams meeting, or even chat with clients in Microsoft teams, you can submit a request in the Okta Access Request Portal contact the #digital-workplace . Currently, any requester who is not already in the pre-approved Sales team exceptions will have to be reviewed by senior leadership. Microsoft Office If you require Microsoft Office and do not currently have the relevant applications on your machine, please send explanation to #digital-workplace Slack channel or digitalworkplace@simpli.fi . If you happen to have Microsoft Office applications locally on your work laptop, you might notice that they are showing an alert about updates. Our current, limited access to Microsoft 2019 licenses are constrained by their pending termination of support (October 2025). We are discussing options whether to renew static licenses or WHAT ABOUT FUTURE DEMANDS? The Digital Workplace team is aware that the current licensing structure for Microsoft Office access is not ideal. It’s a headache for administrators to manually manage static license keys; and users cannot easily access online versions of Microsoft Office and choose to update/download locally. We are currently petitioning senior leadership for the option to provide M365 licenses as needed. But our success in getting such a change approved hinges on helping users find options for their needs within G-Suite first. If you believe you have a good case for Microsoft Office access, please don’t hesitate to share with digitalworkplace@simpli.fi .

title: Customizing Your Inbox: Date Ranges
content: If you’d like to have your Gmail inbox operating more like Outlook or Yahoo (where emails are grouped by custom date ranges), look no further than the Multiple Inbox functionality. Instructions Login to your Gmail account in your web browser of choice. Select the In the Multiple inbox position option, select where you want to see these subdividers appear. (You’d like prefer to see them above your aggregated inbox, but can also select to place them below or to the right of your aggregated inbox). When finished, scroll to the bottom of the settings and click Save Changes You can use this customization for any query that supports how you like to do work--not just date ranges. Need to be able to quickly view things from certain people? Change the search query and section name accordingly. For more information on your options, check out Google’s query documentation.

title: Google Calendar: Time Insights
content: Google Calendar’s Time Insights functionality allows you to see trends in how you spend your time and with whom you spend your time. While there are more robust solutions out there to provide insights into time expenditure (like Timeular , Clockwise , Automate.io , Timing , Webtime Tracker ), Google calendar’s Time Insights feature is free and included with your Google Enterprise access at Simpli.fi. In this quick tutorial, I’ll show you how to gain visibility of your time expenditure--in a way that is customizable to your own categorization and color scheme. For more information, see additional documentation: View How You Spend Time in Meetings (from Google Help Center) How to Use Google Calendar (from Zapier)

title: ✉️ Gmail Signature Disappeared? Here's a Quick Fix!
content: 🧩 What's Happening? Some users have noticed that their email signature disappeared from Gmail . This is related to an ongoing subscription issue within the Gmail system. While that’s being resolved, here’s a simple workaround to get your signature back quickly! 🛠️ Step-by-Step Fix 1. Open Gmail in Chrome Click the ⚙️ gear icon in the top-right corner of Gmail. 2. Click See all settings Once the menu opens, click "See all settings" at the top. 3. Scroll to the "Signature" Section Click + Create new to make a new signature. Paste your previous signature if you have one from an old email. 4. Set the Signature as Default Under the same section: For new emails use: Select your new signature On reply/forward use: Select your new signature again and You’re all Done! Just Some Reminders Clearing cache doesn’t resolve this issue. This method works in Gmail on Google Chrome . If you lost your signature, copy it from a previously sent email! Still Skeptical? This is what the team said 👥 “Mine is good to go now. Thank you!” — Ryan H. “I’m all set as well, thanks!” — Rachel P. Are you Still stuck? Feel free to reach out to #digital-workplace if you are still having this issue, we are happy to help 😊

content: The Bidtellect Simpli.fi team hosts their own Looker solution on premises. Because it is an application protected by VPN access, we advise the following steps for Simpli.fi employees when utilizing: Log into Okta When in doubt about how best to access company tools, think Okta as the origin. if doing so for the first time. ) and utilize the for seamless, secure access. Access P81 Once you’re logged into Okta, you can access P81 either from your: Browser Application Portal Tile Browser Plugin Access Bidtellect Looker via Perimeter 81 When clicking on the P81 tile in Okta for the first time, you will be prompted to download the Okta application. title: Microsoft Office 365 2-Factor Authentication
content: Go to Office 365 Login Page : Open your web browser and navigate to the Office 365 login page ( https://portal.office.com ). Enter Your Email : Enter your Simplifi email address and click "Next." Enter Your Okta Password : You will be redirected to the Okta login page. Enter your Okta password and click "Sign In." Authenticate with Okta Verify : You will be prompted to authenticate using Okta Verify. Open the Okta Verify app on your mobile device. Approve the login request via Touch ID / Fingerprint or by entering the code displayed in the Okta Verify app. Phone Verification : If additional verification is needed, Okta will send a push notification or SMS to your phone. Approve the login request via the push notification or enter the code received via SMS. Finalize Setup Complete Profile Information : Complete any additional profile information required by Simplifi Access Office 365 : Once authenticated, you will be granted access to Office 365. Desktop App Sign In Click the sign in option in any of the Microsoft Desktop Apps. When prompted with the Okta sign in page, ebter your credentials and password. When prompted for MFA, FastPass and/or touchID will NOT work. You may need to click the 'Verify with something else link. This should give you other MFA options like Okta Verify or Google Authenticator for your phone. Once you are logged into the desktop app, you will not be prompted again to authenticate. Troubleshooting Tips Ensure App Permissions : Make sure Okta Verify has the necessary permissions on your phone (camera access for QR scanning, push notifications for approval requests). Keep Information Updated : Regularly update your phone number and other contact information in Okta to avoid issues with authentication. Contact IT Support : If you encounter any issues, you are welcome to contact the Digital Workplace team in our Slack channel or service desk (see: https://simplifi.atlassian.net/wiki/x/B4CUBAE )

title: Intune Enrollment - End User Guide - Win 11 - Register
content: Admin Only: (these instructions are for registering with Intune, not AAD joined) This guide will provide step by step instructions for registering your Windows laptop with Intune. Intune is our laptop management solution that will allow us to remotely manage your device when we transition to a fully remote environment. If you have any questions or concerns about this process, please reach out to the #digital-workplace channel. What Intune is not Intune is not a security application nor is it any type of tracking ‘Big Brother’ type of application. It is used as an inventory management system that allows Simplifi to better support end users while also being able to submit any required audit reports needed by 3 rd party auditors. It is very important that each step is followed exactly as described. If you get stuck at any point, please reach out to #digital-workplace for help. Approx. Time to Complete: ~ 5-10 minutes Prerequisites 1. Okta account activated and Microsoft Intune license assigned. You are assigned Microsoft if you see the app in your Okta Dashboard. note: this is not a full package Microsoft license with Office products. Updated W10/11 laptop. Windows 10 Version 1607 or later navigate to Settings -> System -> About to verify what version you are running Windows 11 any version Part 1: Sign into your Simpli.fi Microsoft account in settings Save your current work before continuing (any open documents or web pages) Navigate to your start menu, and search ‘ Access Work or School’ In the Access Work or School menu, click ‘ Connect’ In the Email Address box, enter your Simpli.fi email address and click ‘ Next ’ Next, you will be prompted to sign into Okta. Okta will prompt you to verify your account with your chosen sign in method. If you need assistance with this portion, please see or reach out to #digital-workplace. Click Yes Once you have signed into your account with Okta, your machine will take 1-2 minutes to register. Please ensure you give your machine ample time to complete this step before moving on. You are done!

content: Admin Only: (these instructions are for registering with Intune, not AAD joined) This guide will provide step by step instructions for registering your Windows laptop with Intune. Intune is our laptop management solution that will allow us to remotely manage your device when we transition to a fully remote environment. If you have any questions or concerns about this process, please reach out to the #digital-workplace channel. What Intune is not Intune is not a security application nor is it any type of tracking ‘Big Brother’ type of application. It is used as an inventory management system that allows Simplifi to better support end users while also being able to submit any required audit reports needed by 3 rd party auditors. It is very important that each step is followed exactly as described. If you get stuck at any point, please reach out to #digital-workplace for help. Approx. Time to Complete: ~ 5-10 minutes Prerequisites 1. Okta account activated and Microsoft Intune license assigned. You are assigned Microsoft if you see the app in your Okta Dashboard. note: this is not a full package Microsoft license with Office products. Updated W10/11 laptop. Windows 10 Version 1607 or later navigate to Settings -> System -> About to verify what version you are running Windows 11 any version Part 1: Sign into your Simpli.fi Microsoft account in settings Save your current work before continuing (any open documents or web pages) Navigate to your start menu, and click ‘ Settings’ In the settings menu, click ‘ Accounts’ In the Accounts menu, click ‘ Access work or school’ in the left hand menu, then click ‘ Connect’ In the Email Address box, enter your Simpli.fi email address Next, you will be prompted to sign into Okta. Okta will prompt you to verify your account with your chosen sign in method. If you need assistance with this portion, please see or reach out to #digital-workplace. Once you have signed into your account with Okta, your machine will take 1-2 minutes to register. Please ensure you give your machine ample time to complete this step before moving on. You are done!

title: How to join a Teams meeting
content: So you have a client or external party that sent you a meeting but it’s being hosted on Teams? No worries, you can still attend this meeting without a license or signing into Microsoft. You will receive an email or web link invitation to join the Teams meeting from the external party . Click the link or paste it in your browser to access the meeting at the scheduled time. If you do not have a link to join the meeting, reach out to the customer or external party. If you are wanting to be the host, create the meeting over Zoom. Click Continue on this browser Accept the popup to ‘ Allow ’ or ‘ Always Allow’ MS teams to access your microphone and camera. If you do not see the popup, click on the little camera icon in the upper right hand corner of your browser bar Enter your name in the top bar to Join as a guest You may need to be accepted or approved by the host of the meeting

title: 🛠 Microsoft Office for Mac – Quick Setup & Fixes
content: Last updated: April 2025 Hey there! If Microsoft Office is giving you trouble, start here. Whether you're setting it up for the first time or running into issues, we've got your back. *BEFORE TRYING ANY STEP, SAVE YOUR PROGRESS * ✅ First Things First: How to Install Office the Right Way Let’s make sure you’re on the latest version. Open Okta Click the Office 365 tile In the top-right, click Install and more Choose Install Microsoft 365 Apps From there just Install Office! Let the #Digital-workplace team know so we make sure you have the right access to your account Now you’re ready to install and sign in with your Simplifi email! 👉 Use your full email + password (FastPass won’t work here) 🚑 Common Fixes (Fast + Friendly) 🧱 Stuck on “Browser Not Supported”? No worries! This means you do not have a license to that supports the Microsoft Office! Your Using an Older Microsoft License Account That Has Had Its Last Days! Here’s a quick refresh: Delete Microsoft AutoUpdate and your Office apps Reinstall fresh from Microsoft Office Using How to Install Office the Right Way This just means your license needs a little nudge. Open Excel Click The Excel Tab in the top left corner of your Navigation, Next to the apple logo About Excel More Info Refresh License This has been a on going issue, so every case is different! Reach out to #digital-workplace if this doesn’t fix your issue 🧾 File Locked or Not Opening? ❌ Can’t Save? Let’s fix that: Quit Excel completely (Force Quit if needed) Wait until it fully closes Try opening the file again Still no luck? Move the file to your Desktop and try again 💬 Still need a hand? Send us a message on the #digital-workplace slack channel & tell us where you're stuck!

title: Miro Board Role Groups - What are they and why do they matter?
content: This board provides a visual representation of the functional roles throughout our organization. A role refers to a position, job title, or set of tasks assigned to an individual. It helps us understand the organizational structure and responsibilities within our company. By visualizing the hierarchy and relationships between roles, we aim to foster a more efficient and effective work environment. Purpose and Significance The primary purpose of this Miro board is to provide a clear overview of our company's functional roles, enabling better collaboration and understanding across different teams and departments. Our company's functional roles are organized using a bottom-up approach, where the lowest point in the hierarchy comes first. The hierarchy is structured as follows: Roles: a position, job title, or set of tasks assigned to an individual Teams : Cross-functional teams, or sub-teams operating within the departments. Value Streams: Sub departments within Engineering. Departments : Situated under each division, representing specific functional areas within the divisions. Divisions : The highest level of the hierarchy, representing the five main divisions in our company: Administration Marketing Client Services Engineering Sales Roles: a position, job title, or set of tasks assigned to an individual Sub Teams : Org Level 4 Teams/Value Streams: Org Level 3 Sub Departments : Org Level 2 Departments : Org Level 1 - The highest level of the hierarchy, representing the five main departments in our company: Administration Marketing Client Services Engineering Sales Naming Scheme Explanation We use a consistent naming scheme for each group to make identification and understanding easier. The naming scheme follows this format: Role : <role-name>_<team-name>_role Sub Team: <sub-team-name>_<team-name>_subteam Team : <team-name>_<sub-department-name>_team (or <team-name>_<vs-name>_team for value streams) Value Stream : <vs-name>_<sub-department-name>_vs Sub Department : <sub-department-name>_<department-name>_subdept Division : <department-name>_dept Why Use This Group Structure? Rather than assigning individual permissions to each user (which is considered bad practice), we can assign permissions based on the person's 'role'. These roles allow us to easily manage permissions for individuals by assigning a few groups, rather than configuring permissions across hundreds of applications. This streamlined approach enhances security, simplifies access management, and reduces the risk of errors. Moreover, with this group structure, any new hire coming into their position already has all the permissions they will need on day one. This eliminates delays in granting access and ensures employees can start being productive right away. This method also ensures that when an employee leaves the company, their access is removed immediately when the groups are unassigned from their profile. Example Scenario Let's illustrate the naming scheme with a few examples: Sales Director on the Northeast Sales Team Role: salesdirector_sales-northeast_role Team: northeast_sales-direct_team Sub Department: directagency_sales_subdept Department: sales_dept Database Engineer on the Ocelots Infrastructure Team Role: dba_infra-ocelots_role Sub Team: ocelots_infrastructure_subteam Team/Value Stream: infrastructure_development_vs Sub Department: development_engineering_subdept Departmetn: engineering_dept

title: Dependency Mapping with Jira Data in Miro
content: Set linkage in Jira (blocks, is blocked by, etc…) Bring children of the Epic into Miro Open Epic Next to your list of Child issues , click the Action Icon (…) and select View in search Highlight and copy (command + c) the JQL Open the Miro Board you intend to manage dependencies in On the left toolbar, click + (Add app) & search for and select Jira Cards In the Jira Cards App, paste (command + v) the JQL; ensure the Advanced Search is toggled On; select all issues by selecting the top check box; and click Add to import the Jira cards to the Miro board Tip: If you have more than 10 Issues in your list, be sure to scroll to the bottom of the screen to ensure all Issues populate BEFORE selecting all Enable Dependencies in Miro In Miro’s top-of-screen toolbar, click the drop-down indicated by 2 downward arrows, and select Dependencies A Dependencies side-panel displays on the right-hand side of the Miro board. Here you can alter dependencies. Dependencies are visually represented by red lines. Drag and drop Jira Cards as desired on the Miro Board.

title: Initial Setup
content: What is Okta? Okta is an identity and access management platform that allows you to use one password for all your applications with an extra layer of security using multi-factor authentication. Okta is the front door to all your applications. Once you’re in, you’ll see a custom dashboard tailored to have all the applications IT has assigned to you. Click on one and you’re automatically logged in. No need to re-enter any credentials. 1. Account Setup You should receive an email from Okta with the subject line “ [ACTION REQUIRED] Hello from the Simpli.fi Digital Workplace Team!” . This email expires after 7 days, so if you need to have it resent to your mailbox please reach out to the #digital-workplace Slack channel or email digitalworkplace@simpli.fi. After you click ‘Activate Okta Account’, it will open your web browser and ask you to set your password . 2. Authenticators at Setup After you set your password and log into your machine, you will be prompted to setup a second authentication method. Only one is required, but it is highly recommended to have multiple. Okta Fastpass (Most Recommended) > System Settings > TouchID) Click ‘ Sign in with Okta FastPass ’ ( you may have to click it twice ) Okta Verify on your machine will open up. Click ‘ Add Account ’ if you do not have Okta Verify on your machine, download and install it Your default web browser will launch and display the Okta login page. Enter your Okta username and click ' Next '. Follow the prompts to sign into your Okta accoun t. After successfully signing in, Okta Verify will open again and prompt you to add your Touch ID with Okta Verify. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete this process. Okta Verify Mobile App (Recommended) A mobile app that Okta sends a push notification to your phone for you to accept or deny. Okta Verify does not collect information or grant us any access to your personal cell phone data. For more information about what this app does and does not do, please see here: or reach out to the #digital-workplace team. How do I setup Okta Verify? Download the Okta Verify app from your app store. When prompted to setup a verification method, select ‘Okta Verify’ Open the Okta Verify app on your phone Click the ‘+' sign in the upper right hand corner, select ‘Organization’, then 'Yes, Ready to Scan’ Scan the QR code on your computer screen Click ‘Enable’ Done! Biometric Login (Required for Mac) If you are using a Mac, you most likely have a fingerprint reader located at the top right. Using your fingerprint allows you to sign into your applications extremely quickly with just the tap of your finger. However, if you choose this method, it is highly recommended to setup a second authentication method, such as Okta Verify to prevent account lock outs in the event you change computers. How do I setup biometric login? When prompted to setup an authentication method, select ‘Security Key or Biometric Authenticator’ When prompted to setup a security key, click ‘Continue’ Tap your finger on the fingerprint reader Done! Google Authenticator (Not Recommended) This option you may have already used with previous applications at simpli.fi . It may be a little more cumbersome to use than the above two methods, but it is just as safe and secure. Google authenticator generates a six-digit code you will type into Okta to sign in. How do I setup Google Authenticator? Download the Google Authenticator app from the app store. When prompted to choose your authentication method, select ‘Google Authenticator’ Open the Google Authenticator app on your phone Within the app, press the rainbow plus sign button in the bottom right hand corner, then select ‘Scan QR code’ Scan the QR code with your phone Click ‘Next’ on your computer Enter the code listed under ‘ login.simpli.fi ’ on your Google authenticator app Done! Finishing Up Once you complete the authenticator setup, you should be led to your end user dashboard or prompted to sign in. Since you are already signed into Okta, you will not need to sign in again to your other apps and can click on them from the dashboard. After you’ve setup these main authenticators, we advise that you also set up We highly recommend installing the Okta browser plug in, which will enable you to quickly access your applications without fully signing into the dashboard. For more information, please see here: Having Issues? If you are having any issues setting up your account, please see . If you are havng issues with Okta Verify, please see . Next:

title: Dashboard
content: The Okta application dashboard is a web interface that allows you to access and manage the applications that have been made available to you. Accessing these application is as easy as clicking on the tile, and your credentials are automatically authenticated against the website by Okta. No need to reenter your credentials when you sign in.

title: Okta Browser Plugin
content: The Okta Browser Plugin is a quick and easy method for logging into your apps without having to sign into the application dashboard. To download the plugin, please click on this link: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/okta-browser-plugin/glnpjglilkicbckjpbgcfkogebgllemb?hl=en Plug in needs Reinstalled: If your Chrome browser loses your Okta Plugin, you may find that you need to add it back to your browser. This sometimes occurs after a system or browser update. Click the Install button and it will take you to the Google store. Click Add to Chrome. Refresh your Okta Dashboard and your apps should go back to working properly. We highly recommend ‘pinning’ your plugin extension on your browser so that it always shows in the toolbar. Click the puzzle icon shown below and then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin. Hint: you can do this for any plugin extension that you use often or need quick access too. Check to make sure your plugin is logged in by clicking on the icon in the toolbar. see gif at top of page. If you get a sign in button like below. Try signing completely out of your Okta Dashboard, then sign back in, it should connect your plugin back. Verify that you are also connected to login.simpli.fi and NOT simpli.okta.com If it shows simpli.okta.com technically it will still work, but there may be some instances that you get prompted for MFA again even though you are already signed in and authenticated. To fix this, click the gear icon and scroll to the bottom of the page. Click Reset Plugin button. Sign out of your Okta Dashboard and make sure you are signing in at login.simpli.fi and sign back in. The plugin should sign in you automatically. If it doesnt and you keep having issues, reach out to a team member in the #digital-workplace channel in Slack.

title: How To Use Okta
content: Click on any of the apps you see and you will be instantly logged in. Signing Into Okta When you are prompted to sign into Okta when attempting to sign into a different app, you will need to use the authentication method you chose. (See here for the setup guide: ) Biometric (fingerprint reader): Enter your username Tap your finger on the fingerprint reader when prompted Done! Okta Verify: Enter your username Check your phone for the Okta Verify push notification (sometimes you need to open the app for it to show up) Press ‘Accept’ Done! Google Authenticator: Enter your username If prompted, select ‘Google Authenticator’ Open the Google Authenticator app on your phone Find the six digit code located under ‘login.simpli.fi’ Enter the code in your browser Enter your password if prompted Done! Okta Browser Plugin For even faster and more convenient method, use the . This allows you to seamlessly sign into all your apps without logging into the dashboard. Okta FastPass See here for more information:

title: Authentication Methods
content: Skip to: How do I set an authentication method after I activated my account? Okta Verify (Highly Recommended) Okta Verify is a multi-factor authentication (MFA) tool offered by Okta that enables users to approve or deny attempted logins with their smartphone. Scan the QR code on your computer screen On your phone, it is suggested to NOT ‘Enable FaceID Confirmation’ I recently purchased a new phone and can’t get into my Okta account. What do I do? Please contact the #simpli-okta or #digital-workplace channel for assistance. Okta FastPass (Highly Recommended) Please see Biometric Login (Recommended) Biometric login for Okta refers to the use of biometric authentication methods, such as fingerprint or facial recognition, as a second factor of authentication in addition to a password. If you were issued a Macbook, you can use the fingerprint reader to meet this requirement. If you have not previously setup your fingerprint reader (Touch ID) for use on your mac, go to your System Preferences > Touch ID > Add Fingerprint. If you need further assistance with this, please reach out to Desktop Support. How do I setup biometric login? When prompted to setup an authentication method, select ‘Security Key or Biometric Authenticator’ When prompted to setup a security key, click ‘Continue’ Tap your finger on the fingerprint reader Done! Google Authenticator (Not Recommended) Google Authenticator is a mobile app that generates time-based one-time passcodes (TOTP) for use in two-factor authentication (2FA) processes. The app generates a new passcode every 30 seconds, which can be used to log into an account on a new device or after a password reset. This method may be more cumbersome to use than the others. How do I setup Google Authenticator? Download the Google Authenticator app from the app store. When prompted to choose your authentication method, select ‘Google Authenticator’ Open the Google Authenticator app on your phone Within the app, press the rainbow plus sign button in the bottom right hand corner, then select ‘Scan QR code’ Scan the QR code with your phone Click ‘Next’ on your computer Enter the code listed under ‘ login.simpli.fi ’ on your Google authenticator app Done! How do I setup an authentication method after I activated my account? Log in to your Okta dashboard ( https://login.simpli.fi ) . Navigate to the Okta settings page (top right, under your name) Under ‘Security Methods’ you can setup, reset, or remove your authentication methods. Choose your desired security method and follow the instructions above. Next:

title: Giving Okta the Finger
content: If you have a Macbook with Touch ID functionality, you can bypass the back-and-forth of push notifications and code entry. (Estimated setup time of instructions : < 2 minutes…) to setup Windows Hello such that you, too, can use biometric authentication. Instructions Begin by following these instructions to setup your Macbook TouchID if you have not already done so. Make sure you are on the latest version of OV by clicking the About section. You should be on at least version 9.10 Once confirmed, you can close this window out and go back to your Okta Verify main window, shown below. Click on your account. If not shown and is asking you to setup up. Click New account and set login.simpli.fi as the sign-in URL Following the redirect to your browser. Please ensure you are being redirect to login.simpli.fi NOT simpli.okta.com You will be prompted to authenticate your account in a new window. Click on your account, and enable touchID. If your Okta Verify desktop client has alerts on the Okta will remember the last authentication method you chose when logging you in the next time. But if for any reason it does not, simply select Verify with something else and select the Okta FastPass option. It should remember going forward! Troubleshooting touchID There may be times when your touchID just stops working or needs to be re-synched to your Okta account. This will sometimes happen after an OS update or Okta Verify update. 1. Open the Okta Verify app located in the top task bar of your laptop. Check to make sure your account is listed, click on your account to go to the touchID section. If you do not see your account, then you will need to register your device to your account. If you do not see any error messages here or any notifications. Toggle the touchID button off/on and it should prompt you to Re-Authenticate your account and connect your touchID. *** NOTE *** Make sure you have your phone available in order to MFA with Okta Verify or another MFA source that you have previously set up. There may be some instances where you will need to Re-enroll if your MFA was reset for a device. Click the Re-enroll link and register your machine.

title: Avoiding Re-authentication
content: To avoid this, we recommend taking the following steps… Upgrade to the Optimal Okta Experience Ensure you have the latest Okta Verify desktop client. Many will have received this update already to their workplace computers via an action taken by the Desktop Support team on February 7, 2023. If not, it is included: For more context on the desktop client of Okta Verify (Fast Pass) see the following resource: When prompted, sign into the Okta Verify desktop client by adding a new account (remove your other one if still present). Click New account and set login.simpli.fi as the sign-in URL Following the redirect to your browser. Please ensure you are being redirect to login.simpli.fi NOT simpli.okta.com Follow the steps to re-enable your Touch ID (see ) If your Okta Verify desktop client has alerts on the If you are in the Chrome browser, reset your Okta Chrome extension: After ensuring you have the most up to date Okta Verify desktop client and an updated MacOS (as applicable), log into the Okta Portal ( login.simpli.fi ) and try clicking an application tile. You should now be able to click into applications without being prompted to re-authenticate. Give Okta the Finger As a general rule, it’s best to ensure you have everything up to date (your operating system, Okta Verify, etc.) But in addition, we HIGHLY recommend setting up touchID with your Macbook or WindowsHello with your PC where available. Biometric authenticators, such as touchID , allow you to sign into your Macbook and into your Okta dashboard with only your finger. No need for password, typing in a code, OR searching for a password notification. Super fast and Super easy. Follow these steps…
