title: New Phone, Who Dis? : Okta After a Device Change
content: If you get a new phone (or new work computer!), the Digital Workplace Solutions team can work with you to reset authenticators in Okta that were tied to your former device. What follows are some steps you can take (and supporting documentation) to setup your new device for seamless login… Instructions: If You Only Have Authenticators on Replaced Device Reach out to the Digital Workplace team in our Digital Workplace Slack channel , letting us know you got a new device. We will reset any authenticators tied to your new device from within the Okta Admin Portal. You will then need to set up impacted authenticators by . Instructions: If You Have Authenticators Across Devices If you happened to already have other authenticators established that are not impacted by the new device, you can log into Okta. On your laptop, go to login.simpli.fi and login with your alternate authentication method You can select, Verify with something else when logging into Okta to change how you authenticate. Select the drop-down menu by your name in the upper, right-hand corner of the Okta portal. Select My Settings. Identify the Security Methods settings. Remove the replaced device Click ‘Set up another’ Verify with your alternative authentication method On your phone, download the Okta Verify app from your app store and open the app. In the app, click the ‘ + ' sign in the upper right hand corner, select ‘ Organization ’, ‘ Skip ', then ' Yes, Ready to Scan ’ Scan the QR code on your computer screen On your phone, it is suggested to NOT ‘Enable FaceID Confirmation’ Done! Instructions: Enabling touchID login on your Mac https://simplifi.atlassian.net/l/cp/sc7H3qVZ

title: Signing into corporate apps on a mobile device
content: Gmail Open the Gmail app. If you are already signed into your personal account, click on your profile picture and select ‘Add Another Account.’ On the ‘ Set up email ’ page, choose ‘ Google .’ Enter your full email address. You will be redirected to Okta; enter your username (your full email) again. Input your password. You may be directed to the ‘Choose your security method’ screen to select your authentication method, or you will be automatically taken to your Okta Verify Push Notification or Google Authenticator code. Accept the push notification or enter the code provided in the Google Authenticator app. Agree to Google’s terms of service. Allow a few minutes for your account to load. Zoom Launch your Zoom app and click on ‘ Sign In ’ On the following page, choose ‘ Sign in with SSO ’ Input our company domain: “ simpli-fi ” When Okta opens, enter your username (your full email address). Type in your password. You may be directed to the ‘Choose your security method’ screen to select your authentication method, or you might be automatically redirected to your Okta Verify Push Notification or the Google Authenticator code. Accept the push notification or enter the code displayed in the Google Authenticator app.

title: Okta Password Reset
content: If you’re ever embarrassed by being locked out of your Okta portal, or hesitant on whom you should ask for help when forgetting your Okta password? Fret no more! You are able to reset your Okta password at any time, provided you have access to Slack. Here are some steps you can take… Steps to Reset Your Password: Okta Slack App Add the Okta app to Slack by clicking on the Apps section of your Slack sidebar menu. Click Manage > Browse Apps In the Apps search bar, type Okta . Add it to your Slack Apps (it has already been configured for access and is available to employees in both Slack workspaces). It should now appear in your Slack sidebar. When you to reset your password, simply click the Okta app under your Slack sidebar Apps section. From the drop-down menu of self-service options, select Okta Password Reset. Enter your company email in the User Email field in the prompt. Click Submit . Steps to Reset Your Password: Slack Shortcut From any message box in Slack, enter the following shortcut /access Okta Password Reset For example, if you’re about to type in the Digital Workplace Slack channel , instead of typing your need, enter the above command. Once you’ve typed it, press the send button. You will then be re-directed to complete steps to provide information for the reset. To proceed, click Continue . Enter your company email address in the field when prompted, and click Submit.

title: Duplicate Tiles in Okta Dashboard
content: Summary Your Okta dashboard has tiles for: Applications that the Digital Workplace Solutions team put behind Okta administration. Applications that are not currently behind Okta, but that the Digital Workplace Solutions team added to all users for purposes of easily maintaining credentials (such as our Simpli.fi UI, which does not yet have SSO capabilities). Applications that you as a user added by allowing Okta to save your password for sites you visit. In the case of the latter, keep in mind that the Digital Workplace Solutions team does not manage those tiles. You have the ability to edit their contents (tile display name, the redirect URL, user name, password, auto-launch capabilities) and even remove the tile. Sometimes, when you allow Okta to save a password for you, it might save multiple tiles (say, in cases where you entered new credentials), just like Google Chrome Password Manager might save multiple sets of credentials. If you have duplicate tiles, you are able to remove an outdated one by: Hovering over the duplicate tile. Clicking the tile. In the side panel that opens on the left, clicking “Remove.” Video Tutorial

title: Disrupting the Infinite Okta Sign-On Loop
content: Have you ever felt like you’re getting the worst kind of deja vu when you try to log into Okta? First Line of Defense: Shutting Down Your Browser Completely shut down Chrome or Firefox. (Please DO NOT simply click the red ' x ' as this does not completely shut down the browser.) Often, this will fix the issue without having to lose any of your browser history. If the issue resolves, you can stop at this step. If it appears to only be impacting the experience in Chrome, clear your browsing data for at least 7 days in Chrome settings. (You can go back further if needed as shown below.) If clearing the cache doesn’t seem to resolve the issue, try rebooting your computer. In the top right of your Chrome browser, look for a small Okta icon Click on the icon for the dropdown menu. Click the person icon here and you should see your account listed. Click on the link to open a new connection and log in. Note: This toolbar icon for the Okta Chrome extension is a quick way to access all of your apps. We do recommend that you sign in first. This Okta Chrome extension allows you to sign in once and you will not be prompted to sign in for the rest of your day. Preventative Medicine In order to prevent this from happening again, be sure to check the Keep me signed in option. Make sure your Chrome browser is up to date. Sometimes you may see an icon in the upper right hand corner letting you know a Relaunch is needed. Please do not ignore these update messages for an extended period of time. These patches often times fix known bug issues and also reduces our security exposure with vulnerabilities. Even if you do not see this label, often times updates are still needed. You can check that by going to /Settings / About Chrome. ( See also, documentation of steps from Google .) Once you have cleared your cache and ensured all updates are applied. Close any open tabs you have open for Simplifi’s Okta page and then reopen at http://login.simpli.fi/ . If Chrome is still having issues, Safari or Firefox will work with out any issues. As always, if you need further assistance, reach out in the Digital Workplace Slack channel . Note: If you have not setup Mac’s touchID setting, we HIGHLY recommend you do this. It is a fast and easy way to log into your Macbook and your Okta account with just the tip of your finger. No need for username/pw or even finding your phone to get a code or Push notification. Look for this circle on the power button. Here is the link on how to set touchID up with your macbook. There is an Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar for quick and easy access to ALL your apps? If you don't see it, click the puzzle piece then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin. From here you can quickly log in to your account and quick access to ALL your apps!

And we will coordinate with you on an ideal day and time for your schedule. Applications Requiring Manual Steps from You There are a few apps that Okta doesn't manage that you would have to update on your end (if you used your gotoadvantage.com account originally for these). Some examples of apps that are not connected with Okta: Rippling (most people use their personal email to log into this anyway) HSA if applicable (related to Rippling; it is recommended to use your personal email) Fidelity (most people use their personal email for this as well) AppleID (if applicable; not everyone has a Macbook or signed up for Apple App Store) IcePanel (if applicable) Bitwarden (if applicable; it is preferred for you to change your email in the settings so as not to lose any personal use of Bitwarden for passwords.) Browserstack (if applicable, will assist in changing logins for developers) Any app integrations you use for Atlassian ( Jira / Confluence ) need to be re-authorized with the Simpli.fi account. You will be prompted to do so when clicking into a relevant app (e.g., Google Sheets, Scribehow) Outlook (if you use Outlook, please update your Gmail settings accordingly to send from both email accounts). Once logged into Gmail website in your browser, go to the settings gear for user email change) Current Status of User Accounts Transitioned from gotoadvantage Domain In the fourth quarter of 2023, a decision was made to update all gotoadvantage accounts to simpli.fi email domains. This was in part for seamless login experience for the user (fewer credential combinations to maintain, or discrepancies between Okta logins). It was also prioritized due to the pending change from Rippling HRIS to UKG HRIS, effective January 1, 2024. To review current status and scheduled day/time of changes for employees on your team, please see this spreadsheet and related Jira Task .

title: The Okta-phant in the Room
content: Sure, there’s no such thing as an Okta-phant. But on the Digital Workplace team, we understand that whenever Okta is mentioned, it garners an exhausted eye-roll from some and trepidatious avoidance from others. We hear you. We get it. We believe it’s our job to listen and make it better for all Simpli.fi users. You’ll never hear us claim that Okta is perfect. But it does have some benefits: Just last quarter Okta prevented and blocked over 200 threat actors. We have saved ~100K since its implementation in license reductions and mistaken assignments. Onboarding efforts reduced significantly (estimated 95% speed-up in application assignments) Even if you do not feel these benefits in your day-to-day, there are a few things we can recommend to make Okta helpful. What follows are some tips for making Okta work for you... Logging into Okta with a Touch You may have seen my reference to in the Digital Workplace channel . It’s true! You can log into Okta without having to check your phone for a code. Simply follow the instructions in the aforementioned article, and you, too, can enter Okta with a quick touch. Please note, the instructions are catered toward Macbook TouchID setup. However, if you would like Windows Hello for the purposes of biometric authentication, you can work with the Digital Workplace Desktop Support Sub-team to obtain that functionality. Auto-launching Applications in Okta Okta works best if you log into it directly from simpli.okta.com at the beginning of your day. So when you’re sipping your first cuppa, log into Okta. We’ve set the session limit for the portal to last beyond your eight hour work day. If you’re logged in there first, you shouldn’t have to log into each of your applications in separate browser tabs. (Some notable exceptions to this are applications, like UKG, that log users out after an hour of activity due to privacy concerns). If you don’t enjoy clicking the Okta tiles, you can auto-launch applications of your choosing each time you log into the Okta portal. That additionally applies for any web apps you store in Okta tile password management, or . (That’s right, ‘there’s a tile for that' if you want it--not just apps that Simpli.fi manages.) Using the Okta Chrome Extension If you want to feel like an Okta power user or hate clicks in general, the Okta Chrome Extension is for you. It has been automatically added to every employee’s Chrome browser. With a simple COMMAND + SHIFT + O , you can begin typing the name of the application you’re wanting to access, hit ENTER and voilà! Improving Employee Experience through Okta Workflows We know employees may not understand the behind-the-scenes work that Okta does in provisioning applications. If we’re doing our jobs, you won’t even think about it. However, as a peek behind the curtain, we can share that: Okta Workflows automate nearly every event-based application update. As one recent example, Kaitlin Purdham used an Okta workflow to provide UKG attributes to the Slack API. Now you can see your colleagues' place in the org chart , their manager, their direct reports (if applicable), their official title, and their start date--all from with an application where you spend most of your time. (Fun fact: thanks to this attribute mapping, your Slack profile now throws you a party on your work anniversary!) We have dozens of Okta workflows to provide the personalized touches that enhance your experience. In short, if there’s an Okta-oddity thwarting your optimal workflow, don’t suffer in silence. If there’s an idea you have to improve operational efficiencies, let us know. Chances are, there’s something further we could do (with Okta) to improve your digital workplace.

title: Perimeter 81
content: What is Perimeter 81? Perimeter 81 is Simplifi’s VPN solution that is broken down by specific networks, where access is maintained by group memberships. Feel free to check out these resources for more detailed information: Tutorials: https://www.perimeter81.com/video#tutorials Knowledge Base: https://support.perimeter81.com/docs via . To do so, they need access to the GCP-PRD network. Additionally, accounting and SWAT team members use the VPN to To do so, they need access to the BT-Tools network. The engineering team largely uses GCP-HA-PRD , GCP-PRD , and GCP-HA-DEV as we are moving away from server solutions with IBM. Though, IBM_SWAT and IBM_VPN are still available during this transition to Google Cloud services. Requirements MAC OS needs to no less than Big Sur, preferably higher ** note: will not install or run from the application page if not updated Windows machines needs to have all updates installed. Okta username/account Requesting Access There are several ways you can request access into the P81 environment. The Digital Workplace team has a built out automated self-service request that allows you to have quick access to the platform. Slack <> Okta Application Request In Slack, search for the Okta app under apps. If you do not see the Okta app, simply click the Add apps option and select the Okta app. Under the Home tab, click the Choose a resource option and choose Perimeter 81 Membership. Slack <> Okta Shortcut Request Alternatively, from within the #digital-workplace channel by typing in the command below directly in the channel… /access Perimeter 81 Follow the prompt to confirm that you would like Perimeter 81 access. In the prompt, enter in your simpli.fi email address and click Submit. Okta Access Request Portal From your Okta dashboard, click on the tile named Okta Access Request. This will open a separate console for you to request the Perimeter 81 app (along with many other apps). Click Request access and you will be prompted with same or similar steps and questions as above. Fill out the request form with your email address only, no other tet or multiple users. Currently, the request can only accept a single network at this time, if you need access to more than one network, please reach out to the #digital-workplace team. Downloading the Harmony SASE (Perimeter 81) App Follow the link below to download the correct install file. https://support.perimeter81.com/docs/downloading-the-agent Once installed, look for the app in your task bar area. Click Sign In . A browser window will open up. Upon first time logging in, if prompted for a company URL, use simplifi .perimeter81.com Click the Sign in with Okta button. If you are already signed into your Okta dashboard, the authentication will be automatic. Otherwise, you will be prompted for your Okta credentials. Click the Checkbox to always allow and click Open Perimeter 81. Once you are successfully logged in, you will be able to see your available networks under Private Networks. along with Quick Access. Troubleshooting Examples Issue resolving DNS names on GCP production. Problem - Able to resolve the FQDN cmak.service.consul, but not just by using cmak. Note: Works correctly on GCP dev and IBM. Possible resolution - P81 support recommended running the following command on MacBooks sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder Reference tickets: https://help.perimeter81.com/support/tickets/71161 Issue accessing desktop client applications (e.g. Slack) when connected to the VPN: Ticket for issue on December 13, 2024 Troubleshooting in Slack between DW, Infrastructure, and end user (Jason Hatton) Resolution Steps identified by Jason Hatton
